column1: Report title: Homicide Trends in United States
Authors: Erica Smith and Alexia Cooper
Figure 48. Percent of all homicides involving intimates by urban, suburban, and rural areas, 1980-2008
Note: Large cities have a population of 100,000 or more, while small cities have a population of less than 100,000.
Percent of homicides by an intimate are based on the 63.1% of homicides from 1980 through 2008 for which the victim/offender relationships were known.
Percent of all homicides involving intimates by urban, suburban, and rural areas, 1980-2008
Note: Large cities have a population of 100,000 or more, while small cities have a population of less than 100,000.
Percent of homicides by an intimate are based on the 63.1% of homicides from 1980 through 2008 for which the victim/offender relationships were known.
